alert.note: Alert for Bergen; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 12:17AM EDT until April 08 at 11:37PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Jersey... Ramapo River At Pompton Lakes affecting Morris, Bergen, and Passaic Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ramapo River At Pompton Lakes. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Nuisance, low lying flooding, occurs near the dam in the Pompton Lakes. At 11.5 feet, South section of Pompton Lakes experiences flooding. At 12.5 feet, Several residences in Pompton Lakes, along Riveredge Drive, take on water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 12.1 feet. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.0 feet on 12/24/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (2 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Stg Time Date Ramapo River Pompton Lakes 11.5 10.6 Thu 11 p 11.0 9.9 12.1 8am 4/08 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1215 PM EDT.
